title: KeralaHighCourtCauseList
description: Complete schema for Kerala High Court daily cause list. One document per calendar date. Captures every field observed in the 772-page 18-Feb-2026 audit: all section types including mediation/arbitration, advocate roles, IAs, compliance items, urgent memo details, linked cases, parse warnings.

metadata.description: Top-level document header printed once at the start of the PDF

court_name.example: High Court of Kerala at Ernakulam

time.description: Court sitting start time as printed

source_pdf.description: Filename or object-storage URL of the source PDF

source_pdf_url.description: Public download URL from the KHC website

ingested_at.description: UTC timestamp when this document was ingested

total_pages.description: Total pages in source PDF — for completeness validation

total_courts.description: Total court bench blocks found — for completeness validation

total_cases.description: Total CaseItem rows across all courts — for completeness validation

parse_warnings.description: Non-fatal issues from ingestion — unknown section types, malformed numbers, truncated blocks etc.

courts.description: All court benches and special lists (Mediation Centre, Arbitration Panel) in document order

Court.description: A single court bench block — or Mediation Centre / Arbitration Panel block — with its presiding officers and all list sections for the day.

court_number.description: Court number as printed including alpha suffix. E.g. '1', '2B', '5D', '6B', '7A'. Use 'MED' for Mediation Centre.

court_code.description: 4-digit room/hall code alongside the court number

is_division_bench.description: True when exactly two judges sit together

is_full_bench.description: True when three or more judges constitute a Full Bench

is_cj_court.description: True if the Chief Justice presides

is_mediation_centre.description: True for the KHC Mediation Centre block. judges array will be empty.

is_arbitration_panel.description: True for a court-annexed arbitration panel block.

court_page_start.description: PDF page (1-indexed) where this court block header first appears

total_items.description: Total CaseItem rows across all sections in this court

judges.description: Presiding judge(s). Single=1, Division=2, Full=3+. Empty for Mediation Centre.

lists.description: All list sections within this court for the day, in printed order

full_name_raw.description: Name exactly as printed in the BEFORE: block
full_name_raw.example: HON'BLE THE CHIEF JUSTICE MR. SOUMEN SEN

short_name.description: Honorifics stripped, title-cased — for display and cross-day deduplication

honorific.description: Personal title: MR. / MS. / MRS. / DR. etc.

CauseListSection.description: A named segment within a court block. A single court may have multiple sections (e.g. Admission + Separate List 1 + Urgent Memo).

section_type.description: Normalised section category. Use OTHER if header does not match any known type, and record section_label verbatim.

section_label.description: Header exactly as printed: 'ADMISSION', 'FOR HEARING', 'CJ'S COURT CAUSELIST', 'DAILY LIST CAUSELIST', 'SEPARATE LIST 5', 'SUPPLEMENTARY LIST 1', 'URGENT MEMO', 'MEDIATION LIST', 'BOARD LIST', 'RETURNABLE LIST', 'DEATH REFERENCE LIST' etc.

section_number.description: Ordinal for numbered sections (SEPARATE_LIST 1…N, SUPPLEMENTARY_LIST 1…N). Null for un-numbered sections.

section_page_start.description: PDF page (1-indexed) where this section begins

item_count.description: CaseItem count in this section — for per-section validation

CaseItem.description: A single case row (one Sr.No. block) including parties, advocates, IAs, linked cases, compliance items, and section-specific details.

serial_number.description: Sr.No. as printed. Plain string for top-level ('1', '506'). Dotted for sub-items ('1.1', '101.23'). Always string — never integer.

is_sub_item.description: True when serial_number contains a dot — this case is clubbed under a parent

parent_serial_number.description: serial_number of parent CaseItem when is_sub_item is true

case_number_raw.description: Full case number exactly as printed

case_type.description: Case type code parsed from case_number_raw. Open string — not enum-restricted because new types emerge with new legislation.

case_category.description: Pre-computed broad category. Derivation: WP*/WA/CRP/CMA/FAO/RSA/SA/OP/OA/Mat.*/Arb.*/Comp.*/Tr.P(C)/Cont.Case(C) = CIVIL; Crl.*/OP(Crl.)/RPFC/Tr.P(Crl.)/Cont.Case(Crl.) = CRIMINAL; MEDIATION_LIST = MEDIATION; ARBITRATION_LIST = ARBITRATION.

filing_mode.description: Normalised filing mode from the prefix printed under Sr.No.

filing_mode_raw.description: Filing mode exactly as printed, e.g. 'ONLINE', 'OFFLINE-SC', 'OFFLINE-NOT ADMITTED', 'ONLINE-ADVOCATE'

bench_type.description: Bench composition — denormalised from parent Court judge count for fast filtering

petitioner_names.description: Petitioner/appellant/applicant names as printed. Literal 'Others' preserved to represent '& Others'.

party_in_person.description: True when the petitioner appears without an advocate — indicated by party name printed in the advocate column or explicit 'PARTY IN PERSON' text

remarks.description: Full remark block exactly as printed

status.description: Normalised status derived from remarks. UNKNOWN when absent or unrecognised.

order_date.description: Date of a prior court order referenced in remarks — parsed from e.g. 'DOCUMENTS AS PER ORDER DTD 4.2.26 NOT RECEIVED'

next_listing_date.description: Next hearing date if case is adjourned to a specific named date printed in the list

interim_order_expiry.description: Expiry date of interim order — appears only in URGENT_MEMO section entries

urgent_memo_by.description: Advocate name from the 'URGENT MEMO BY:' field

urgent_memo_service_status.description: Service status as entered by applicant in urgent memo block, e.g. 'SERVICE IS NOT COMPLETE (ENTERED BY APPLICANT)'
urgent_memo_service_status.example: SERVICE IS NOT COMPLETE (ENTERED BY APPLICANT)

mediation.description: Populated for MEDIATION_LIST entries only. Null for all other sections.

arbitration.description: Populated for ARBITRATION_LIST entries only. Null for all other sections.

advocates.description: Structured advocate listing split by side. PARSING RULES: (1) The '———' dashed line separates petitioner advocates (above) from respondent advocates (below). (2) Multiple advocates on one line separated by '/' each become a separate AdvocateEntry. (3) First before '/' gets is_lead_advocate: true. (4) GP, PP, AG entries go into respondent_advocates with correct role enum.

petitioner_advocates.description: Advocates for petitioner/appellant/applicant side, in printed order

respondent_advocates.description: Advocates for respondent side. Each carries represented_parties. Includes GP, PP, AG entries.

other_advocates.description: Advocates of ambiguous or general capacity — Amicus Curiae, Court Commissioner, etc.

interlocutory_applications.description: All IAs / CM Applications / Crl.M.Appls clubbed under this case — the '& TYPE NUMBER/YEAR (PURPOSE)' lines

linked_cases.description: Cases cross-referenced via WITH or IN keywords

pending_compliance.description: Typed pending compliance items extracted from remarks — drives compliance alerts in the dashboard

page_number.description: PDF page (1-indexed) where this Sr.No. block begins — enables direct PDF page jump while app is PDF-backed

raw_text.description: Complete raw extracted text for this case item — for re-parsing and debug. Strip from all client-facing API responses.

ComplianceItem.description: A single typed pending compliance requirement extracted from a case item's remarks block.

description_raw.description: Compliance requirement text exactly as printed

due_per_order_date.description: Date of court order that mandated this compliance, if parseable from the remarks

MediationDetails.description: Fields specific to MEDIATION_LIST entries. All properties optional — mediation list verbosity varies.

mediation_file_number.description: Mediation centre internal reference if separate from court case number

referral_court.description: Court label that referred this case to mediation

referral_case_number_raw.description: Original case number in the referring court if different

parties_present_note.description: Any printed note about required attendance or confirmed presence
parties_present_note.example: Both parties to remain present with counsel

ArbitrationDetails.description: Fields specific to ARBITRATION_LIST entries. All properties optional.

AdvocateEntry.description: A single advocate entry. PARSING RULES: (1) Split '/' into separate entries. (2) First before '/' = is_lead_advocate: true. (3) Role abbreviation map: SC=SENIOR_COUNSEL (or STANDING_COUNSEL when institutional context), GP=GOVERNMENT_PLEADER, PP=PUBLIC_PROSECUTOR, APP=ADDITIONAL_PUBLIC_PROSECUTOR, AG=ADVOCATE_GENERAL, AAG=ADDITIONAL_ADVOCATE_GENERAL, SPL.GP=SPECIAL_GOVERNMENT_PLEADER, CGC=CENTRAL_GOVERNMENT_COUNSEL, ASC=ADDITIONAL_STANDING_COUNSEL, DSG=DEPUTY_SOLICITOR_GENERAL, SG=SOLICITOR_GENERAL, B/O=BRIEF_ON_BEHALF_OF.

name_raw.description: Name exactly as printed after '/' split

name_normalized.description: Honorific stripped, title-cased — primary key for advocate dashboard queries and cross-day deduplication

honorific.description: Printed prefix: SRI / SHRI / SMT / KUM / DR / ADV etc.

role_raw.description: Role annotation exactly as printed — e.g. 'SC, BPCL', 'ADDL. ADVOCATE GENERAL', 'SPL.G.P.(REVENUE)', 'CGC', 'B/O'

represented_parties.description: Party labels this advocate is noted against — e.g. ['R1','R2','R7'], ['APPELLANT']. Empty array when not specified.

is_served.description: True if 'SERVED ON' printed next to entry. False if explicitly unserved. Null if not mentioned.

organization.description: Institution explicitly named alongside the advocate entry

is_lead_advocate.description: True if first-listed on their side (before any '/' separator) — used for dashboard header display and push-notification targeting

InterlocutoryApplication.description: An IA, CM Application, Crl.M.Appl, or CMAP printed as '& TYPE NUMBER/YEAR' with optional purpose on the next line.

ia_type.description: IA type code: IA, CM.Appl, Crl.M.Appl, CMAP etc.

ia_purpose.description: Purpose text in parentheses below the IA line — e.g. 'CONDONATION OF DELAY IN FILING THE COUNTER AFFIDAVIT', 'RECEIVING ADDITIONAL DOCUMENTS', 'STAY'
ia_purpose.example: CONDONATION OF DELAY IN FILING THE COUNTER AFFIDAVIT

ia_status.description: Status of this specific IA if noted separately — 'PENDING', 'ALLOWED', 'DISMISSED'

ia_advocates.description: Advocates specific to this IA when listed separately from main case advocates — rare

LinkedCase.description: A case cross-referenced via WITH, IN, or CROSS_OBJECTION keywords.

link_type.description: WITH = clubbed for joint hearing. IN = this case was filed within the referenced case. CROSS_OBJECTION = cross-objection.

linked_case_petitioner.description: Petitioner name of linked case when printed inline — common in SEPARATE_LIST sub-items

linked_case_advocates.description: Advocates listed specifically for this linked case when different from parent case advocates — common in SEPARATE_LIST bundles
